When the beloved leader of a military unit is raised as a wight, sometimes the spirits of their comrades return with them, creating a gestalt being of impeccable tactical acumen. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Wight Commander](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1917) **Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 169 **Perception** +22; (+26 when rolling initiative) [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +24, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +25, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +25 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +5 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +3 **Items** [Full Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13), +1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [longsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=31), [standard-grade adamantine shield](/Equipment.aspx?ID=310) (Hardness 10, HP 40, BT 20) --- **AC** 32 (34 with shield raised) **Fort** +24 **Ref** +19 **Will** +21 **HP** 220 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)**
**Final Spite** ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) **Trigger** The wight commander is reduced to 0 Hit Points; **Effect** The wight commander blows a battered war horn before being destroyed. The unnerving blast summons reinforcements, raising 1d4 corpses in a 200-foot emanation as [wights](/Monsters.aspx?ID=413).
**[Shield Block](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=32)** --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _longsword_ +27 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 2d8+14 slashing plus drain life **Melee** claw +26 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d8+14 slashing plus drain life **Divine Innate Spells** DC 29 - **Constant (5th)** [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Coordinated Strike** The wight commander flanks with an ally as long as the target is within both their reaches, even if commander and ally aren't on opposite sides. **Drain Life** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) When the wight commander damages a living creature using an [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attack or their bound weapon, they gain 12 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or become [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10). Further damage dealt by the wight commander's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4. **Spawn Wight Soldier** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) A living [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91) killed by a wight commander's weapon or claw Strike rises as a different wight spawn of the commander's level or lower (most often a [hunter wight spawn](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1915) or [prowler wight spawn](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1916)) after 1d4 rounds. This wight spawn is under the command of the wight commander that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn wight and are [clumsy 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) for as long as they're a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn wight, and are no longer clumsy. **Tactical Direction** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16)) Each wight ally in a 30-foot emanation gains the [Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3) reaction until the end of their next turn.
